page.title: 07INNS IN L.STAUGHTON
page.content: In this block there are{two Public {Houses,}the "Crown" in Little Staughton and the "White Horse" in Keysoe. The former is a modern building which replaces the one destroyed by fire. Two other ancient inns of the village were destroyed during World War 2 to make way for the airfield. The " White Horse" is an early 15th century inn of great character. Both are popular meeting places with traditional games of dominoes, darts and skittles. Both serve a range of hot and cold bar food which is increasingly popular costing around two pounds. Beer is 78p. a pint. Lager, wines and spirits are widely sold. The "Crown" also has a restaurant and the "White Horse" an attractive garden in which drinks and meals are served in the Summer.
